comments.commentBody: I too was happy to see how gracious Mr. Obama and Mrs. Clinton were. But I guess when you and everything that you stand for is so thoroughly repudiated, you don't have much choice. Just a great day in America, this foolish leftist path that we have been traveling down has been wiped away and we are now poised to start anew and begin to get back on track. Wonderful!

Shame on the media, especially CNN which happily brought in ratings by showing Trump 24/7 and allowed people like Trump's former campaign manager (and other partisan hacks) to get free air time.  Those of us who are liberal need to focus on boycotting media that engage in such tactics.  Rule with your pocketbook!

I would like to tell men that I am truly offended that this misogynist is going to be our next president!  If you happen to have a daughter, you should know that things like this do make a huge difference to girls.  Over the years, these types of messages do sink in and tell you something about who you are, what people think of you, and whether you have worth.  For all those men who voted for this guy, you just gave your daughters a huge message that they aren’t worth much, and that message will be repeated over and over again because they will have to look at this guy over and over again for the next 4 years.
The beautiful thing about falling to the ground is the part where you pick yourself up and carry on, wiser, and stronger.

Perhaps Mr. Trump's victory will help the NY Times rethink its role as a wing of the loser Democrat Party.

Trump 2020. Peace & Prosperity.

Trump seems to think the things he said during the campaign can somehow be unsaid, and we can all sit around the fire holding hands and singing kumbaya. Newsflash: you didn't get a popular mandate, Mr. Trump. And for the millions of Americans who are appalled by (and are rejecting) this election result, you would lend some weight to your claim that you want to be a President for all Americans if you proceeded with Merrick Garland's nomination for the Supreme Court... instead of packing it with Pence-approved old white men who will roll back the right to marry who we choose, and have control of our own bodies.

"Immigrants".

I offer you a tiny nugget of why Trump won. I'd imagine many Trump voters don't truly support the man; nor his behavior or half-baked, incoherent policy proposals. No-- they're voting against a media establishment (which includes television news, print journalists, late-night comedians, ESPN, celebrities) that deliberately hijacks words and phrases in the name of political correctness to push an agenda.

No other word perfectly captures this deception than the left's (and the entire media establishment's) co-opting the term "Immigrant". The word is truly meaningless now. Whether you're a Nigerian getting your PhD and waiting years for citizenship, or a border crosser from Mexico...it makes no difference. Conflation of "immigrant" with "illegal alien" makes it impossible to have reasoned discourse. You're either for "immigrants" or you're a deplorable racist. And for what? What's the end goal here? Is it because "illegal" and "alien" are icky words that make you uncomfortable? Pathetic.

There's a suffocating feeling of anger, frustration and helplessness when this deception is thrown in your face every single day. Normal people don't have a platform to scream at the heads of CNN or the New York Times--

But they do have a vote.

Being an American in the Trump years will be demonstrably easier than being an American in the Obama years. You "progressives" or as some would say, socialists or communists, have been drubbed by the citizens which you have failed to listen to and upon whom you have shouldered trillions of dollars of debt, laughable economic programs, a pourous border, bogus concerns about the climate and environment as an excuse to kill entire industries and render citizens bankrupt, a total lie of an "Affordable" health law, and the tolerance of job losses to other countries........It is time for you to sit down and allow adults to address the problems which you have attempted to resolve through increasing taxes, regulation and executive fiat.

Your embrace of a candidate who's ethical lapses are well documented illustrates your addiction to power and your inability to put Country above your desire to tell us all how to live, what car to drive, what to eat, who our doctor can be, give "free" college, "free" medical care...........truly a swamp of rules, regulations and laws that need to be drained.

You have disdain for the Americans who voted for Trump. You put down whites who want to take back their country from the devisive policies of the last 8 years. You see things differently than the majority of this country. The way you see the country is not the way this country is. This is not a nation of victims! It is not a nation of people who are discriminated against and denied opportunity. But that's what you see when you look out and see America.
You didn't lose because the American people don't want a woman to win and to "crash through the glass ceiling". You lost because your ideas were rejected. You lost because your ideas have been on display for the last eight years and people don't want any more of them.

He deserves a chance. Look at his track record over the past 500 days:  Trump defeated 17 opponents including Hillary (more than anyone in history); he survived non-stop attacks in the biased media and unparalleled attack ads, dirty illegal tricks (DNC-paid agitators at his rallies), rigged questions at the debates (CNN-DNC cheating), attacks on his family/wife (pictures), false accusations, and all with ZERO political experience, AND he spent one-half of what the dems spent.

P.S. to the Editorial Staff:   Please!  Do your investigative journalism and report on Trump's pals Guilliani, Christie, Gingrich, Bannon!   Facing Trump as President is scary enough - we can't tolerate these "advisers" to come along with him!

MOTIVATED OR DEFENSIVE DELUSIONS. Some predisposed persons might suffer the onset of an ongoing delusional disorder when coping with life and maintaining high self-esteem becomes a significant challenge. In order to preserve a positive view of oneself, a person views others as the cause of personal difficulties that may occur. This can then become an ingrained pattern of thought.

Well the NYTimes blew the predictions on this one, and was unable to influence the election, despite trying on multiple fronts. The deficit, growing amount of entitlement programs were ignored many times by the NYTimes and its editorialists.  The liberal elite ignored the needs of the masses, perhaps making themselves feel better by seeming to care.  I found out that Thomas Friedman married into some good amount of money (mazel tov!) and lives in a 14 ,000 sq foot mansion, but somehow he is able to speak for all. I don't subscribe to that view. The Americans living in the Midwest/ Rustbelt need jobs.  The country needs safe boarders and well thought out immigration policies.  Let's give President - Elect Trump a chance.  .... and I'm willing to forget her emails, and PERHAPS the Clinton Foundation shenanigans.
Nice graphic.  It says it better than anything.

Populism used to be a good thing.  Now, it's just ordinary people with stupid ideas.  Hopefully, Donald has some previously undisclosed correct notions for running the country.  Not likely.  Mourning in America!

Just as the right solution to him as a candidate was to look him in the eye and laugh heartily without stopping the solution now is to look him in the eye, shake your head side to side then look away and down as you walk away with a sad exasperated sigh.
He is all ego, it will destroy him.

I hope, but an skeptical, that the Times can follow the example set by Clinton and Obama. Will you exhibit optimism or continue to sew division throgh a non-stop stream of hyperbole and worse case predictions.

Thank you NYT for a gracious editorial.   Now, would the Editorial Board do some soul-searching on journalism and your responsibilities in that field?!  Please - back to investigative journalism and reporting on the important issues you have mentioned in this editorial.   Enough of the "fair and balanced" reporting - we need facts - desperately!

"Thou hast it now: King, Cawdor, Glamis, all,
As the weird women promised, and I fear
Thou play'dst most foully for't"

Maybe Clinton and Obama are gracious in their defeat, but the NYT editorial board is not. What about an apology for running a partisan campaign through your newspapers against Mr Trump, and one of fawning adoration to Clinton? What about an apology for predicting an 80%+ chance of Hillary becoming President? What you have done is taken the risk of NYT losing its press credentials for the next four years. Was it worth it?
It's mourning in America.

"Many immigrants to shield?"
I have to wonder,will this include hiding my friends and neighbors in my attic?
This is nothing short of a disaster for America and the world.

I want to thank Hillary for her words to "the little girls". My 11 yo daughter really tuned in for that part of her speech.  She has been hearing Trump's mean-spirited comments to and about women all along , it was helpful for Hillary to say what she did.

I believe you are making the same mistake, with hubris.

People have spoken. It is against political correctness. It is against this elitist discussion 'at' vs 'with' the rest of the country. Pls new York Times, get some moderate Republicans on your Editorial Board...your coverage will better represent the wider readership...see election results. Some time should be spent on self reflection.

The ppl just didn't want Clinton. Amongst many things, like corruption, started wars, depended on super delegates vs connecting with voters, preaches to people with a bias that the electoral college fundamentally rejected.

More Plainspeaking please NYT
